title: How to Make Halloween Pumpkin Jell O Treats
steps: Remove the peaches from the can.
Carve pumpkin faces on the peaches full-side.
Place the carved peaches into the shallow dish.
Make the Jell-O or jelly liquid according to the package instructions.
Place in the refrigerator to set.
Remove once set.

title: How to Dress Up a Pumpkin with a Stocking
steps: Take the stockings out of the packaging.
Ease the pumpkin inside the stocking.
Wrap the open end of the stocking around the stem of the pumpkin.
Done.

title: How to Light a Pumpkin for Halloween
steps: Finish carving your pumpkin.
Use candles.
Create a chimney hole to release the heat from the inside for either style of pumpkin.
Use a battery powered light.
Consider using other types of lights.
Enjoy your lighted pumpkin display.

title: How to Maintain a Carved Pumpkin
steps: Mist diluted bleach onto the entirety of the pumpkin.
Spray the inside, outside and cut surfaces of your pumpkin with a commercial pumpkin preserver.
Place your carved pumpkin in a tub or large bowl filled with cold water, carved side down.
Rub the raw edges of your pumpkin with a thin layer of petroleum jelly.
Put your pumpkin in a cold place.

title: How to Make a Succulent Pumpkin Centerpiece
steps: Buy a fake, craft pumpkin made from foam.
Use a small pot to trace a circle on top of the pumpkin.
Cut along the line that you drew.
Fill the pot with cactus soil.
Plant your succulents into the soil.
Tuck the pot into the pumpkin.
Water the succulents when the soil is dry.

title: How to Clean a Pumpkin
steps: Make sure your work area is safe.
Cut into the pumpkin slowly.
Address injuries quickly.

title: How to Pick Pumpkins
steps: Choose a design to carve before you go shopping for pumpkins.
Check for a smooth, uniformly colored skin.
Keep an eye out for smaller, "sugar" pumpkins for eating.
Knock on the shell.
Set the pumpkin up to make sure it sits level.
Leave as much of the stem on as possible.

title: How to Eat Pumpkin
steps: Serve roasted pumpkin as a side.
Mash your pumpkin if you want a creamy side.
Simmer your pumpkin puree to make pumpkin soup.
Bake your pumpkin into a pie for a classic treat.
Try adding pumpkin puree to other baked recipes to make delicious desserts.
Add cooked, diced pumpkin to savory dishes to add texture and flavor.

title: How to Preserve a Pumpkin
steps: Use a fully ripe pumpkin.
Wash the pumpkin.
Cut the pumpkin into chunks.
Boil the pumpkin until soft.
Remove the pulp.
Mash the pulp.
Cool the pumpkin.
Pack the pumpkin into rigid containers.
Freeze the pumpkin until ready to use.

title: How to Peel a Pumpkin
steps: Prepare the pumpkin by washing and slicing it into smaller sections.
Bake the pumpkin in an oven.
Cook the pumpkin using a microwave.
Peel the pumpkin using the vegetable peeler method or the knife method.

title: How to Prepare a Pumpkin Shell for Soup
steps: Place the pumpkin into a steamer large enough to hold it.
Steam until the pumpkin starts to soften.
Remove from the heat.
Remove the seeds and with a good, solid knife, carve out the flesh to about 2" or 5 centimeter (2.0 in) to the edge.
Pour in the soup and serve.

title: How to Make a Pumpkin Cake
steps: Prepare to make the cake.
Whisk the sugar and wet ingredients.
Sift the dry ingredients.
Combine the wet ingredients with the dry.
Pour the cake batter into the pan.
Bake the cake.
Have the cake cool.
Frost and decorate the cake.
Serve and enjoy!.

title: How to Shell Pumpkin Seeds
steps: Have the seeds as a snack raw.
Fry the pumpkin seeds.
Roast the pumpkin seeds.
Finished.

title: How to Freeze Pumpkin
steps: Take your desired amount of pumpkin out of the freezer.
Thaw your pumpkin in the fridge.
Defrost your pumpkin on the counter for same-day use.
Run warm tap water over your pumpkin.

title: How to Eat Pumpkin Seeds
steps: Know that many people prefer to eat pumpkin seeds whole, along with the shell.
Pry the pumpkin shell open and get at just the seed.

title: How to Make Pumpkin Dog Treats
steps: Prep a batch of multi-species treats.
Prepare a muffin tin.
Bake for about fifteen minutes.
Snack on pumpkin seeds together.
